intro: Centaurea margaritacea subsp. proto-gerberi, commonly known as the proto-gerberi centaurea, is a flowering plant species native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom in summer. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its visual interest.
